Class NailingPlanks

  • java.lang.Object
    • NailingPlanks

  • public class NailingPlanks
extends java.lang.Object
    You are given two non-empty zero-indexed arrays A and B consisting of N integers. These arrays represent N planks. More precisely, A[K] is the start and B[K] the end of the K−th plank. Next, you are given a non-empty zero-indexed array C consisting of M integers. This array represents M nails. More precisely, C[I] is the position where you can hammer in the I−th nail. We say that a plank (A[K], B[K]) is nailed if there exists a nail C[I] such that A[K] ≤ C[I] ≤ B[K]. The goal is to find the minimum number of nails that must be used until all the planks are nailed. In other words, you should find a value J such that all planks will be nailed after using only the first J nails. More precisely, for every plank (A[K], B[K]) such that 0 ≤ K < N, there should exist a nail C[I] such that I < J and A[K] ≤ C[I] ≤ B[K].
    Version:
    Nov 1, 2015
    Author:
    Tyler Hagerty

      static boolean isValid(int[] A, int[] B, int[] C, int minNumNails)
      Checks if the number of nails being tested by the binary search in the solution method will nail down all the planks defined by A and B (nails are chosen sequentially from C).
      static void main(java.lang.String[] args) 
      static int solution(int[] A, int[] B, int[] C)
      given two non-empty zero-indexed arrays A and B consisting of N integers and a non-empty zero-indexed array C consisting of M integers, returns the minimum number of nails that, used sequentially, allow all the planks to be nailed.

      • solution

        public static int solution(int[] A,
                           int[] B,
                           int[] C)
        given two non-empty zero-indexed arrays A and B consisting of N integers and a non-empty zero-indexed array C consisting of M integers, returns the minimum number of nails that, used sequentially, allow all the planks to be nailed. Uses binary search, time complexity: O((N + M)*log(N)) where M = #nails, N = size A/B
        Parameters:
        A - The starting position of the ith plank
        B - The ending position of the ith plank
        C - The position where each nail can go
        Returns:
        The minimum number of nails that need to be used for all planks to be nailed in, sequentially

      • isValid

        public static boolean isValid(int[] A,
                              int[] B,
                              int[] C,
                              int minNumNails)
        Checks if the number of nails being tested by the binary search in the solution method will nail down all the planks defined by A and B (nails are chosen sequentially from C). Uses prefix sum of the number of nails total encountered at each position in order to aid in this check (using start position A[i] and end position B[i] of each board, make sure a new nail has been added to the prefix sum within those bounds).
        Parameters:
        A - The starting position of the ith plank
        B - The ending position of the ith plank
        C - The position where each nail can go
        minNumNails - The number of nails proposed by the binary search to be tested that this amount can nail all planks.
        Returns:
        true if the number of nails fulfills all requirements, false otherwise
